Package com.ubicua.didas.ui

Class ThemeUiTab

java.lang.Object
com.ubicua.didas.ui.ThemeUiTab
All Implemented Interfaces:
org.keycloak.component.ComponentFactory<org.keycloak.component.ComponentModel,org.keycloak.services.ui.extend.UiTabProvider>, org.keycloak.provider.ConfiguredProvider, org.keycloak.provider.Provider, org.keycloak.provider.ProviderFactory<org.keycloak.services.ui.extend.UiTabProvider>, org.keycloak.services.ui.extend.UiTabProvider, org.keycloak.services.ui.extend.UiTabProviderFactory<org.keycloak.component.ComponentModel>
public class ThemeUiTab extends Object implements org.keycloak.services.ui.extend.UiTabProvider, org.keycloak.services.ui.extend.UiTabProviderFactory<org.keycloak.component.ComponentModel>
ThemeUiTab integrates a custom "Service discovery" tab into the Keycloak Admin UI client-details screen and validates discovery attributes on client roles.

It implements both UiTabProvider for runtime behavior when the tab is active, and UiTabProviderFactory for discovering and initializing the tab at startup.

Discovery Document Validation

The onUpdate(KeycloakSession, RealmModel, ComponentModel, ComponentModel) method ensures that updated configuration for 'context' and 'roles' obeys DID Document rules (valid HTTPS URIs, no spaces, correct syntax, mandatory attributes on each referenced role).

Author:
Ivan Kuchumov

    • onUpdate

      public void onUpdate(org.keycloak.models.KeycloakSession session, org.keycloak.models.RealmModel realm, org.keycloak.component.ComponentModel oldModel, org.keycloak.component.ComponentModel newModel)
      Validates changes to the 'context' and 'roles' configuration when a component is updated. Two kinds of change are inspected:

      1. Change to the context attribute – must be a comma‑separated list of valid HTTPS URIs without spaces.
      2. Change to the roles attribute – the new role list must be syntactically correct and all referenced roles on every client must carry the mandatory discovery attributes. See validateAttributes(RealmModel, String) for details.
      Specified by:
      onUpdate in interface org.keycloak.component.ComponentFactory<org.keycloak.component.ComponentModel,org.keycloak.services.ui.extend.UiTabProvider>
      Parameters:
      session - current request session
      realm - realm owning the component
      oldModel - previous persisted state
      newModel - proposed new state (already validated by base Keycloak)

    • validateAttributes

      private void validateAttributes(org.keycloak.models.RealmModel realm, String newRoles)
      Validates that the comma‑separated list of discovery roles
      1. contains no spaces,
      2. matches identifier syntax ^(\\w+,?)+\\w+$,
      3. each referenced role exists on at least one client,
      4. and each role carries exactly three attributes ("id", "context", "service") whose values are syntactically valid. Detailed regex checks are embedded inline.
      Parameters:
      realm - realm to search for clients and roles
      newRoles - comma‑separated role list from component config

    • getConfigProperties

      public List<org.keycloak.provider.ProviderConfigProperty> getConfigProperties()

      public String getPath()
      Specified by:

      Returns:

    • getParams

      public Map<String,String> getParams()
      Returns fixed route parameters for the tab, binding 'tab' to 'discovery'.
      Specified by:
      getParams in interface org.keycloak.services.ui.extend.UiTabProviderFactory<org.keycloak.component.ComponentModel>
      Returns:
      route parameters for the Admin UI router – here we fix the tab parameter to “discovery”.
